designScenario.name: Oxygen Supply and Regulation System
designScenario.description: This design outlines an Oxygen System intended for aviation applications, integrated within the Environmental Control System (ECS). The system ensures continuous delivery of breathable air at safe oxygen concentrations, maintains pressure stability, and provides emergency oxygen supply during cabin depressurization. It employs redundant oxygen sources, precise monitoring, and automated control to adhere to aviation safety standards.

details.description: Maintain cabin oxygen concentration between 19.5% and 23.5% by volume using oxygen generators and distribution systems.
Ensure oxygen delivery pressure matches cabin pressure to prevent leakage and maintain consistent supply.
Automatically deploy emergency oxygen masks and activate auxiliary oxygen sources within 2 seconds of cabin depressurization.
The system shall detect oxygen levels below 19.5% and initiate corrective actions within 3 seconds.
Implement dual oxygen generation units and independent distribution pathways to ensure uninterrupted supply during single-point failures.
All components must support rapid replacement and maintenance in accordance with FAA-approved modular standards.
Provide real-time oxygen level displays and fault diagnostics on the ECS control panel.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Generation Unit
systemComponents.description: Generates and regulates oxygen supply using onboard sources or bleed air.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Concentrator
subComponents.description: Extracts and purifies oxygen from cabin air via pressure swing adsorption technology.

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Maintains consistent oxygen delivery pressure matching cabin pressure requirements.

subComponents.name: Filter Module
subComponents.description: Removes particulates and contaminants from oxygen supply.

systemComponents.name: Distribution Network
systemComponents.description: Distributes oxygen to cabin zones via ducts and outlets.

subComponents.name: Outlet Valves
subComponents.description: Regulates oxygen flow to individual passenger and crew zones.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Monitoring System
systemComponents.description: Continuously measures oxygen levels and triggers alarms for deviations.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Electrochemical sensors distributed across cabin zones.

subComponents.name: Alarm Module
subComponents.description: Audible/visual alerts for low oxygen levels and system faults.

systemComponents.name: Emergency Oxygen Supply
systemComponents.description: Stores and deploys emergency oxygen masks and auxiliary oxygen canisters.

subComponents.name: Emergency Canister Bank
subComponents.description: High-pressure oxygen canisters for rapid deployment.

subComponents.name: Mask Deployment Mechanism
subComponents.description: Automatically releases oxygen masks from overhead panels.

systemComponents.name: Control Unit Interface
systemComponents.description: Manages oxygen system operations and interfaces with the ECS control panel.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Control Module
subComponents.description: Processes sensor data and sends control signals to actuators.

subComponents.name: Status Display
subComponents.description: Graphical interface showing real-time oxygen parameters.

relationships.description: The Oxygen Generation Unit provides oxygen to the Distribution Network for cabin delivery.
Sensors in the Oxygen Monitoring System send data to the Control Unit Interface for analysis.
The Emergency Oxygen Supply activates based on commands from the Control Unit Interface during depressurization.
The Oxygen Concentrator is a core component of the Oxygen Generation Unit.
Outlet Valves are integrated into the Distribution Network to regulate zone-specific oxygen flow.

attributes.name: oxygenConcentrationRange
attributes.description: Safe oxygen concentration levels maintained within the cabin.

attributes.name: deliveryPressureRange
attributes.description: Pressure range of oxygen supplied to cabin outlets.

attributes.name: emergencyResponseTime
attributes.description: Maximum time to deploy emergency oxygen during depressurization events.

attributes.name: oxygenStorageCapacity
attributes.description: Minimum emergency oxygen reserve capacity for all passengers and crew.

attributes.name: sensorRefreshRate
attributes.description: Rate at which oxygen sensors sample cabin oxygen levels.

comments.body: System must maintain oxygen purity above 95% at all times

rag_context: The Oxygen System information and specifications are not provided in the given context.
